result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony A. GROOTHOFF

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, the defendant entered a plea in 16 CM 42.   Motion granted.   
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 03-29-2016 at 11:00 a.m., Br. 2.

State informs the Court that defendant never showed up for his settlement conference.   Settlement conference reset with DA to 03-10-16 at 10:00 a.m.   
Notice.  
Minutes.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 01-28-16 at 10:15 a.m.   Plea date is set for 02-12-16 at 10:30 a.m.   Bail is set at $250.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Gina McCorkle.   Bail furnished.    
Minutes.

RE:  Gina McCorkle, on 11-09-15.
Initial appearance is set for 01-04-16 at 1:30 p.m.
